person.persName: Elisha B. Treadway (Owsley County, Kentucky, carpenter, sheriff, capt & maj 7th KY Inf USA; maj 3 Forks Battalion USA)

body.p: Owsley County, Kentucky, carpenter, sheriff, and soldier. Kentucky native. Son of William W. Treadway. Married to Sarah E. Treadway. Father of Morgan J. Treadway, Laura F. Treadway, Decatur B. Treadway, and Philos Stratton Treadway. Carpenter in Owsley County in 1850. Carpenter in Owsley County in 1860. Employed Malissa J. Eager as a domestic servant and William F. Eager as a carpenter in Owsley County in 1860. Sheriff in Owsley County from 1860 to 1861. Served as a second lieutenant in the 3rd Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment in the U.S.-Mexican War. Served in the 7th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a captain and major from September 22, 1861, to September 24, 1864. Served in the Three Forks Battalion of Capital Guards (U.S.A.) as a major from February 1, 1865, to July 17, 1865.
